title: What if I told you...
body:
...that a border wall for the United States would be a pointless waste of money, incredibly time-consuming, would not only not solve the US's immigration but ultimately hurt the US?

And I say this not because I support illegal immigrants, but because I actually understand history and the socio-economic problems in South America that are causing the immigration issue. And that in actually, by definition the United States has a *refugee* problem, not an *immigration* problem?

Because that is what it is; its a REFUGEE problem, caused by the socio-economic turmoil brought about by the US's War on Drugs, the vast corruption afflicting many South American countries and the massive privatization of South America because of things like NAFTA which in turn is feeding the corruption and ruining the economies of cities and people, which causes more problems with drugs, which causes more problems with (list continues to loop).

And that if we want to solve this problem, the United States and the United Nations are going to have to man up, admit they fucked up a lot of things in South America and set about fixing them so that people don't need to flee to the United States just to have the hope of not getting shot or starving to death in their own country.

But hey, a wall is easier, right?
